title: min_const_fn doesn't take #[allow_internal_unstable] into account

labels.name: A-stability
labels.description: Area: issues related to #[stable] and #[unstable] attributes themselves.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-const-fn
labels.description: Area: const fn foo(..) {..}. Pure functions which can be applied at compile time.

body:
The `intrusive-collections` crate has a [macro](https://github.com/Amanieu/intrusive-rs/blob/bebd10d4bb6efc9ce6a6e3080703e4f59e7dff59/src/adapter.rs#L174) which defines a `const fn` that may have complex trait bounds. This macro uses `#[allow_internal_unstable]` to allow crates to use this macro without needing to enable any nightly features (just the "nightly" cargo feature on `intrusive-collections`).

To reproduce simply run `cargo test` on the crate: it will fail in one of the doc tests:
```
running 9 tests
test src/adapter.rs - intrusive_adapter (line 123) ... ignored
test src/adapter.rs - intrusive_adapter (line 131) ... ignored
test src/adapter.rs - intrusive_adapter (line 150) ... FAILED
test src/lib.rs -  (line 152) ... ok
test src/key_adapter.rs - key_adapter::KeyAdapter (line 19) ... ok
test src/adapter.rs - container_of (line 85) ... ok
test src/lib.rs -  (line 93) ... ok
test src/lib.rs -  (line 22) ... ok
test src/lib.rs -  (line 190) ... ok

failures:

---- src/adapter.rs - intrusive_adapter (line 150) stdout ----
error: trait bounds other than `Sized` on const fn parameters are unstable
  --> src/adapter.rs:168:35
   |
19 | intrusive_adapter!(MyAdapter3<'a, T: ?Sized> = &'a Test2<T>: Test2<T> { link: LinkedListLink } where T: Clone + 'a);
   |                                   ^

thread 'src/adapter.rs - intrusive_adapter (line 150)' panicked at 'couldn't compile the test', librustdoc/test.rs:333:13
note: Run with `RUST_BACKTRACE=1` for a backtrace.


failures:
    src/adapter.rs - intrusive_adapter (line 150)

test result: FAILED. 6 passed; 1 failed; 2 ignored; 0 measured; 0 filtered out

error: test failed, to rerun pass '--doc'

```
